reviews.review: Very organized class with tons of resources. Easy with coding knowledge. MT2 is the hardest. No curves. Hard topics include tree, recursion. Recent past exams are useful for test prep. Homework is easy. Projects are challenging. Watch the videos before class. A wide division in the class between ppl knows how to code vs. ppl first-time coding.
reviews.subject: CS61A

reviews.review: Most concepts will not be in the lecture but in the videos. The pace can be fast for students without coding experiences. The course is easy as there are a lot of resources available for students. Good utilization of those can guarantee you to achieve good grades on exams. There was some extra credit if you turned in your work early.
reviews.subject: CS61A

reviews.review: As someone with no previous coding experience, this class was very hard to do well in. It is very easy to pass the class though if you finish all of the homeworks, labs, & projects. The exams are extremely hard, partial credit is nice though. Lecture format was not for me, had to watch videos before class. Study with other people & pray on exams
reviews.subject: 61A

reviews.review: I struggled in this class, partly due to the format (videos to watch before each lecture that cover most of material while lecture is more for review). This style was difficult for me, although I know it works well for other people. That being said, I should've used OH and other supplemental materials more, which I would say is big for this course
reviews.subject: CS61A

reviews.review: Fantastic professor, it's very obvious how passionate he is about the subject- evidently cares about his students  as well. Steep learning curve (for someone who's never coded before) but u just have to lock in and do all the homeworks/ask for help on labs. The tests are difficult but you learn so much from this class.
reviews.subject: CS61A

reviews.review: Really funny guy, but you could tell especially from his last lecture that he cares a lot about this subject and its impacts on the world as a whole. He's a great teacher, but this class is honestly a lot more dependent on your own efforts regardless of how good the professor is.
reviews.subject: 61A

reviews.review: a great professor. lectures are very clear and provides plenty examples in class time. very organized and funny too! one of the best professors in uc berkeley.
reviews.subject: CS61A

reviews.review: Best Introductory Course for CS ever
reviews.subject: CS61A

reviews.review: Unbelievably talented and diligent professor who is great at teaching material. The EECS/CDSS department is lucky to have this legend.
reviews.subject: 61A

reviews.review: Professor DeNero was amazing and he re-sparked my love for computer science. Not only does care and help students during labs and discussions, but he also is hilarious and his lectures are just a joy to attend. Shout out to the scheme art contest and the kpop dance group during the first lecture.
reviews.subject: CS61A

reviews.review: THE GOAT PROFESSOR :) Inspires me to pursuit a CS major!
reviews.subject: 61A

reviews.review: A bubbly personality to keep me and other students going in the TOUGH introductory curriculum of Computer science. Communicates his office hours availabilities, responds to emails fast, and can just walk up to him. After each class there usually is a line though.
reviews.subject: CS61A

reviews.review: The exams were too hard compared to homework, labs, and projects. Whatever you practice during the semester, expect it to be twice as hard on the exams. Scheme was the least enjoyable part of the course, ... and useless...
reviews.subject: 61A

reviews.review: Denero is a unique professor to take in CS61A. Use clear examples that explain code and the strategies you can expect from solving complex tasks/problems. He welcomes any questions that arise mid-lecture lecture, allowing students to ask a variety of coding solutions or general questions. Great professor for any student (even freshmen/transfer)!
reviews.subject: 61A

reviews.review: Inspiring. The best. The greatest. GOAT
reviews.subject: 61A

reviews.review:
really good at explaining concepts, encourages questions & won't make you feel stupid when you ask questions during lab/lecture, super nice and approachable outside of class too (like on ed or via email)

the class grade bins are pretty difficult if you're aiming for an A/A+ but still somewhat doable if you get all the EC/hw/lab/discussion points
reviews.subject: 61A

reviews.review: Amazing professor to introduce students to CS & Berkeley. 61A exams are tough but he's very accessible and there's a clear path to success if you put in the work. Lectures are great and he has a way of conveying key ideas in a simple way. Prof. DeNero made 61A amazing.
reviews.subject: CS61A

reviews.review: Genuinely one of the best professors at Berkeley. There is a reason he is regarded as the GOAT.
reviews.subject: CS61A

reviews.review: Good professor who has a good sense of humor. 61a for me was just very hard, but grade bins are fair enough to pass (C) even if you basically bomb all your exams.
reviews.subject: 61A

reviews.review: great lectures but very hard exams
reviews.subject: 61A

reviews.review: I dreaded taking a class online based on several past experiences but Dr. Benoit's class was better than any others I've taken. His expectations are clear and the lectures are fun. His assignments are hard but helpful. After finishing his class, I am confident with python and also understand computing in general so much better than before
reviews.subject: DATASCI200

reviews.review: Benoit was a great professor for Python. My class included students already with enormous amounts of Python experience (I had coding experience, but not Python) as well as students who had never approached the subject. He made the course engaging for those of us who had worked in CS before, and made novice students feel confident with the material.
reviews.subject: DATASCI200

reviews.review: Fairly tough class but interesting and enjoyable. Dr. Benoit's lectures are engaging and he creates assignments that are approachable without making them too easy. Some people in my class were clearly already proficient with the material while some people had no experience at all.
reviews.subject: DATASCI200

reviews.review: I know some programming, never got "bigger picture" til now, or the basics to create a framework for understanding all of computing, for problem-solving until now. He handled students who shdn't have been in the course (with CS and DS degrees & with lots of experience on the job) along with people new to coding. He covered all! Caring & friendly
reviews.subject: DATASCI200

reviews.review: Taking Python with Dr. Benoit & loving it. The class includes experienced programmers and novices (I am somewhere in the middle) and he makes it work well for all of us. Hoping to take another course with him in the future if possible.
reviews.subject: DATASCI200

reviews.review: Gerry is our Python instructor. He is an amazing instructor. I learned so many new things from him even if I have done some programming before. He makes the class fun, engaging, and interactive. He provides positive feedback.
reviews.subject: DATASCI200

reviews.review: Dr. Benoit made studying Python enjoyable and straightforward. Online courses have always been a peeve of mine but he ran this class well. Other students and I enjoyed his lectures and his friendly, clever personality.
reviews.subject: DATASCI200

reviews.review: Benoit is great. Whatever Berkeley is paying him... It isnt enough! One of the most talented lecturers I have encountered, particularly for a technical course such as Python.
reviews.subject: DATASCI200

reviews.review: Such a nice guy and helpful professor. Gets excited about the material during every class which makes the course more enjoyable. Would recommend Benoit to anybody.
reviews.subject: DATASCI200

reviews.review: Dr. Benoit is an absolute delight! His lectures are well-planned and engaging. He exhibits his passions for information science and teaching in every class. Benoit genuinely cares about the success of his students, and pays close attention to the class-comprehension as well as the comprehension of each individual. A truly outstanding professor!
reviews.subject: DATASCI200
